ygData.subject: Re: Languages
ygData.msgSnippet: Got an idea. Considering both of the people we know that have received Gnoll as a language are rangers, perhaps rangers get to know creature languages, being
ygData.messageBody:
Got an idea.

Considering both of the people we know that have received Gnoll as a
language are rangers, perhaps rangers get to know 'creature' languages,
being that their focus would be animals and animalesque creatures.

I wouldn't doubt that eventually they may learn Orc as well.

kalekona@... wrote:
>
> From: <kalekona@...>
>
> This is my experience in languages.
>
> 1. You must be grouped with whom you are learning.
> 2. He/She must have greater skill than you.
> 3. You must talk in /gsay for it to increase your
> level.(Never raised my skill with /say /tell or /shout).
> 4. As for skills being allowed even after not meeting the
> creature. I think that certain ones can be learned just
> because of your level. After I level up I am sure to visit
> my guildmaster and he has one or two languages for me to
> learn. Otherwise I would know Sphinx, and Gryphon, and Hill
> giant allready...hehe.
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> Star Wars fans are using ONElist to share the fun.
> http://www.ONElist.com
> Are you?
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> This list is intended for the trade of Spell components for spell research. Please keep the emails on topic.
